revised_title: Recombination of Electrons and Atomic Ions: A Study of Collisional-Radiative Processes
tldr: This article investigates the recombination of electrons and atomic ions in optically thin plasmas. A statistical theory called collisional-radiative recombination is developed, which considers the interaction between collisional and radiative processes. The study focuses on hydrogen-ion plasmas and finds that the collisional-radiative recombination coefficient increases with the number density of free electrons. The results also suggest that the coefficient is not very sensitive to the species of singly charged ions involved.
